condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: More than 55,000 Venezuelan children, adolescents and their families arriving in Tumbes received information on hygiene practices, personal and family care, in addition to access to services. Over 2,000 migrants voiced their opinion on services received through participation in accountability mechanisms: satisfaction surveys, focus group sessions and suggestion boxes at the Binational Border Service Centre (CEBAF). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: # of affected population in targeted areas actively participating in accountability mechanisms supported by UNICEF
# people reached in affected areas with messages on life saving skills and protective practices and behaviours, as well as on information on access and use of services
